heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 16 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (208°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.4°C) and outside temperature (down 3.2°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 729 m) and light levels (up 8349 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5455 lux) and cloud levels (up 1010 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 728.7m lower than yesterday, 392.3m lower than the past week, 1010.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 702m and a high of 2980m, averaging 869.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, fog or low cloud is expected, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. Changeable conditions.
